newsitem.title: JAPAN: Volvo sees higher 1997 Japan sales.
newsitem.headline: Volvo sees higher 1997 Japan sales.

text.p: Volvo Cars Japan Corp, the Japanese unit of AB Volvo, on Thursday forecast sales of 25,000 vehicles in Japan in 1997, up from 24,037 in 1996 when they rose 17 percent from the previous year.
The company said it hopes for annual sales of 30,000 vehicles by 2000.
Volvo Japan also said it will start selling S40 and V40 cars made at its Dutch joint venture NedCar in Japan in October.
NedCar is equally owned by Mitsubishi Motors Corp, AB Volvo and the Dutch government.
